column4: hey guys now i am running 10.04 from 6-7 months and did not faced any problems, but now a days system is rebooting and shuting down slowly, can you suggest me some software like 'disk cleanup' or some thing similar, though i have not used such software in past
u can use the autoclean terminal command to start off get :'"sudo apt-get autoclean"
what does that program exactly do ?
but dude i have not installed many softwares by compiling them
it removes partial packages, and that kinda stuff. theres also a way to get rid of residual copnfig files
will that command even clean all the .deb packages in /var/cache/apt/archives ?
depends. I think it just cleans old and unneeded packages
because i have made that location my repo and for my other computers i install the softwares from there
so can i run autoclean program safely ?
You should be able to, although I would suggest doing a quick backup to a thumbdrive, just to be safe :D

to remove old config files (can take up quite a bit of space), open synaptic package manager, then go to the bottom left and click status. then click the "not installed(residual config)" option above it. Tick all the packages you see on the right and press apply.
to remove unnecessary locale data, you could also run "sudo apt-get install localepurge" this will remove any unused language files from anything installed
your computer shouldnt be that bad then, when did u get the computer, how full is the hdd, are you running compiz effects, do u have a graphics card?
no i do not run compiz effects and all the other graphics stuff, i just do not like them, most of the time i spend on terminal, that is the reason why i am worried
oh ok, then. that's quite strange....any background processes you forgot about?
although admittedly, they would have to be massive to make any big problems
background process would be apache , mysql ,ssh, smtp server and other general stuff
shouldnt be that bad................interesting.  I really don't know. when was the last time you turned it off?
